edu.calpoly.spritely

Class ImageTile

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.calpoly.spritely.ImageTile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Tile

    public class ImageTile
extends java.lang.Object
implements Tile
    A tile that shows an image. The image may be any format supported by Java's ImageIO class, which should include PNG and JPEG. Alpha blending is supported: A pixel in a tile may be semi-transparent. ImageTile instances are immutable.
    See Also:
    ImageIO.read(File)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageTile

        public ImageTile(java.io.File imageFile,
                 Size size,
                 char text)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Create a ImageTile with the given image, at the given size, and that is represented by the given character when in text mode. The image may contain transparent and semi-transparent pixels.
        Parameters:
        imageFile - A file containing a valid image file
        size - The size of a tile, in pixels
        text - The character representation of this tile in text mode
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error reading the image
        See Also:
        ImageIO.read(File)

      • ImageTile

        public ImageTile(java.net.URL imageURL,
                 Size size,
                 char text)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Create a ImageTile with the given image, at the given size, and that is represented by the given character when in text mode. The image may contain transparent and semi-transparent pixels.
        Parameters:
        imageURL - A url referring to a valid image file
        size - The size of a tile, in pixels
        text - The character representation of this tile in text mode
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error reading the image
        See Also:
        ImageIO.read(File)

    • Method Detail

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                  Size size)
        Description copied from interface: Tile
        Paints this tile into the given graphics context g. g will be set up so that tiles that are underneath this tile will show through if this tile has transparent, or semi-transparent pixels.

        Note that Spritely optimizes repainting. It will only paint a frame if it needs to, because a different set of tiles is on a given square. See the documentation about immutability at the beginning of this class.

        Specified by:
        paint in interface Tile
        Parameters:
        g - The Java graphics context to draw into, with an appropriate translation and crop already set.
        size - The size of this tile. For a given window, the value of size will never change.
        See Also:
        AlphaComposite.SrcOver
